meanings.definition: To decompose a compound by passing an electric current through it.
meanings.sent1: I will electrolyze water to separate it into hydrogen and oxygen.
meanings.sent2: Scientists electrolyze salt to obtain chlorine gas and sodium hydroxide.
meanings.sent3: The mad scientist tried to electrolyze his sandwich to see what would happen.
meanings.sent4: The intense heat seemed to electrolyze the very air around us.
meanings.sent5: The electric current was so strong that it could electrolyze metal in seconds.

meanings.definition: To separate a substance into its components by electrolysis.
meanings.sent1: We can electrolyze copper sulfate to get pure copper.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician will electrolyze the solution to extract the desired compound.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he could electrolyze the ingredients to make the perfect dish.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to electrolyze the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The power surge was so strong that it could electrolyze any material in its path.
